channel.title: How do I redirect a domain?
channel.description:
Ok well I'm sure this is so simple that I'm going to smack myself in the head about it, but anyways...
Say I have a big ole ugly URL for something. Of course I don't want people to have to type it in or whatever so I go buy a simple related domain name.
How do I make to so that when they enter the simple domain, it takes them to the ugly domain?

item.title: How do I redirect a domain?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“mjordan, post:43, topic:311555”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=408003.msg3019066#msg3019066 date=1257458008]

It breaks everything, search engines won’t index it. Your ‘back’ (and forward) button becomes completely useless, you can’t link to anything, etc etc etc.

It’s just bad practice.
[/quote]Hmm well it seems that namecheap uses an iframe to redirect and mask. They call it URL frame or something. That really disappoints me, looks like I’ll have to use godaddy.[/quote]

Or set an A record (or CNAME) and see how you like it, as said above it may be what you actually want.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I redirect a domain?

item.title: How do I redirect a domain?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It depends on what you want to do. But if you want a forward then just use the forward your DNS host provides. (which they accomplish by the same means we outlined here, .htaccess, PHP’s header, etc)

Read full topic

item.source: How do I redirect a domain?

item.title: How do I redirect a domain?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

That is not what you asked for. An A record points your domain to an IP, it will not redirect to your other domain or page when the domain is typed in, unless you set your server up to redirect it as was discussed before.

For example bla.moparisthebest.com is a CNAME record which points to moparisthebest.com (which is an A record pointing to the IP of this server), if I didn’t have my server set up to redirect *.moparisthebest.com to www.moparisthebest.com, you could view this thread at http://bla.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,408003.20.html OR http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,408003.20.html
Which is NOT a redirect, which is what he asked for.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I redirect a domain?

@Cheese_Police wrote:

You guys are fucking retarded.

mjordan: http://rscott.org/dns/a.html

You need to set an A record on your domain that points to your webserver, it is different for every registrar (as in, where you go in the control panel), but basically:

That is using namecheap, but you get the idea (I hope).

You’re correct though. I just bought the domain and want it to be directed to a site when someone types it in. Is that possible to do without having hosting?

item.title: How do I redirect a domain?
item.dc:creator: @mjordan mjordan
item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:19, topic:311555”]PHP and the ‘.htaccess’ way of redirecting are identical to the browser, so both ways are the same. You may choose one over the other however because if you are using another server besides apache, you won’t have ‘.htaccess’ files (although there will likely be an equivalent for your particular server), and if you don’t have PHP, then that obviously isn’t an option.

Stay away from the HTML redirects though, unless you have to use them (you don’t here).[/quote]Hmm alright thanks! So looks like PHP it is.

la­wl:

wherever you bought your domain, you should be able to set it up there

You know, now that I think about it I believe I did see something at GoDaddy about redirecting. Will every site do this? Because I’m trying to steer away from godaddy and use someone like namecheap.

P.S. lol this thread got so offtopic for a little. I believe me and ron are the only ones to get the batman award???

Read full topic
item.source: How do I redirect a domain?
